name: Winter Solstice
description:
You wake up in a mysterious house with nothing but a map and a flashlight. You have no idea why you're there, but you do know one thing. You have to collect presents, you're not sure why.

Controls (because I didn't have time to make a tutorial):

-E to pick up collectibles/open doors when pointer is highlighted

-WASD and Mouse to look around and move

-Space to vault over/through objects when prompted

-Left Shift to Sprint

-When the red bar is full, he has found you, but if you stay out of his sight long enough, he'll go away

(edit: I forgot to mention you can jump through windows, It's kind of a key gameplay mechanic. whoops)

And one last thing, you're treading on sacred ground, it's common courtesy to make an offering to the deceased.

Warning: bugs and potentially poor performance

I haven't had too much time to actually code the game and test it on low performing machines. This is also my first high-effort 3D game so feel free to drop feedback but don't expect triple-A standards.
